definitions: The action of twisting or the state of being twisted, especially of one end of an object relative to the other.
A measure of the twisting of a curve or surface in three-dimensional space.
The twisting of a body by the exertion of forces tending to turn it about an axis.
examples: The bridge collapsed due to excessive torsion.
The engineer calculated the torsion on the beam.
Torsion can be a significant factor in material fatigue.
